intro: Geum vidalii, commonly known as Vidal's avens, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers in late spring to early summer. Its flowering stems are generally hairy and can grow up to 30 centimeters in height. Geum vidalii prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
